subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College

mods.abstract: On March 29, 1922, ground was broken for the Dairy Barn, the first building constructed on the new campus. Holding the shovel is Gov. John M. Parker, known as the “father of the Greater University” for his support of a new expanded campus.; Typed on front:"'The first shovelfull of dirt' for the erection of the Greater Agricultural College being turned by Governor Parker. Standing to the right of Governor Parker are P.L. Himes, Horace Wilkinson, Col. T. D. Boyd, Pres. of the University, Col. A.T. Prescott, __ , Dalton Reymond, Prof. Atkinson."
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
